summary: This bill, the "Head Start for America's Children Act," amends the Head Start Act to improve various aspects of the program. Key changes include updating definitions, authorizing appropriations, modifying financial assistance, establishing regional and program offices, and altering requirements for allotments, federal shares, and children with disabilities. It also addresses curriculum, agency designation, standards and monitoring, program powers and functions, transition to K-12, collaboration, administrative requirements, eligibility, Early Head Start programs, technical assistance, staff qualifications, mental health services, research, reporting, and staff wages. New programs are authorized for community eligibility, partnerships with higher education, extended operation, and collaborations with child care providers. Also, the bill clarifies full calendar year requirements and makes provision for Native American and Migrant Head Start programs.
